Advisory Council

Meet our advisory board

At the Indian School of Hospitality, we sincerely value the power of ideas. Our advisory board is in place to ensure our continued strive towards growth and innovation. Comprised of thought leaders and heads of various industries spanning across hospitality, education, and business, our advisory board ensures constant development towards bettering our educational approach and philosophy and understanding of industry requirements.

Ajay Bakaya | Managing Director, Sarovar Hotels

Ajay Bakaya is a seasoned hotelier, responsible for overseeing the operations, development and expansion of Sarovar Hotels, which have a portfolio with over seventy-five hotels across fifty destinations in India and Africa.

Ajay joined Sarovar over two decades ago, and has been instrumental in the success story of the company. He led its growth from their first hotel in Goa, to today’s enviable portfolio that encompasses Sarovar Premiere, Sarovar Portico, and Hometel brands. A postgraduate from Cornell-Essec, France, Ajay is a graduate from the Oberoi School of Hotel Management. He has a passion for travel and is a keen cyclist. He was awarded “Entrepreneur of the Year” by the Federation of Hotels & Restaurants Association of India and the “Hall of Fame” award by Hotelier India.

Read more

Frits van Paasschen | Former CEO of Starwood Hotels & Resorts and Author of Amazon Bestseller ‘The Disruptor’s Feast’

Frits van Paasschen is the former CEO of Starwood Hotels and Coors Brewing Company. Prior to being CEO, he was President of Nike Europe, Middle East and Africa and Vice President of Finance at Disney.

He began his career as a consultant at the Boston Consulting Group and McKinsey. Mr van Paasschen has served on the corporate boards of Oakley, Jones Apparel, and Barclays. He was Chairman of the European-American Industrial Council and a board member of both the US-China and US-India Business Councils. Mr van Paasschen was the Dean's Distinguished Lecturer at the Cornell School of Hotel Administration and a Conti Professor at the Penn State School of Hospitality Management. As an MBA student, he lectured in economics as a Teaching Fellow at Harvard College. Mr. van Paasschen is an avid traveller and has had numerous visits to India across the span of three decades.

Ingo Schweder | Founder & CEO, GOCO Hospitality

Founder & CEO of GOCO Hospitality, Ingo Schweder brings more than 30 years of experience from the fields of spa and hospitality. He has been involved with the design, development and worldwide operation of iconic hotels and wellness destinations.

Ingo is considered to be one of the foremost hotel and spa experts in the world, and his experiences and accolades to date are a fitting testament. Under his guidance, Ananda in the Himalayas, the globally recognised destination spa, was established. During his tenure at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group, he established 15 spas across four continents. Prior positions include Group Director of Hotel Operations for Oberoi Hotels & Resorts and Managing Director of Rafael Group Hoteliers, Southeast Asia.

Jean-Michel Cassé | Chief Operating Officer for India and South Asia, Accor Hotels

A seasoned hotelier, Jean-Michel brings over three decades of industry experience and deep understanding of varied cultures, having worked across multiple international markets in Europe, Asia, Middle East and Africa.

In his most recent role as Senior Vice-President for AccorHotels, India, Jean-Michel has played a pivotal role in the Group’s success in India. Under his leadership, AccorHotels now has a 46 hotels presence in the country. Widely recognised for his outstanding skills, expertise and contribution, Jean-Michel Cassé was awarded a Gold Bernache for Professionalism by the Chairman of AccorHotels in 2004. In 2007, he was conferred with the “Chevalier de l’Ordre National du Merite”, a French honour for distinguished civil and military achievements by the erstwhile French President.

Kapil Chopra | President, The Oberoi Group

An alumni of The Oberoi Centre for Learning and Development (OCLD), Mr. Chopra's experience as a hotelier spans over nineteen years.

Most recently, Mr. Chopra was the Executive Vice President of the Group and was instrumental in opening two flagship properties - The Oberoi and Trident in Gurgaon. Mr. Chopra was also voted "Hotelier of the Year" by Hindustan Times in 2012. The Oberoi Group was voted 'World's Leading Luxury Hotel Brand' by the World Travel Awards in 2012. Furthermore, under Mr. Chopra's leadership, The Oberoi, Gurgaon was voted 'World's Leading Luxury Hotel' by the World Travel Awards for the second consecutive year in 2012. The Oberoi, Gurgaon was also awarded 'Best Hotel for Business in India' by Condé Nast Traveller, India, Readers' Travel Awards 2012.

Neeraj Govil | Area Vice President - South Asia Marriott International

With over twenty years of hospitality experience spanning across multiple countries and various Marriott International brands, Neeraj Govil is the Area Vice President - South Asia.

He is responsible for strategic leadership and focus on establishing brand positioning and expanding effective market share of the Marriott International brand portfolio in South Asia.

Nirupa Shankar | Director, Brigade Group

Nirupa is a Director of Brigade Group's hospitality division, Brigade Hospitality and a Director of Brigade REAP.

She oversees the operations & strategy for the company's self-managed assets, which include convention centres, serviced apartments, lifestyle membership clubs, banquets, and event management. She also asset manages the group's hospitality ventures, such as the Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway and Grand Mercure Bangalore, in addition to eight new projects in the pipeline. In addition to her role in hospitality, she is involved with the Group's overall business development and strategy.

Ragini Chopra | Vice President (Corporate Affairs & Public Relations), Jet Airways

Ragini Chopra was the female management trainee to graduate from the Oberoi School of Hotel Management in 1975. Thereafter, she spent 28 years with Oberoi Hotels and Resorts in various senior capacities.

These included operations, sales and marketing, branding and launch of the groups Luxury Resorts, as well as heading both corporate sales and marketing and corporate communications; culminating in her assignment as Vice President Business Development for the group. She has undergone the Senior Management Development Programme at Cornell University in the United States, and has attended the Summer University programme conducted by Harvard Business School.

Rajiv Kaul | President, Leela Palaces, Hotels & Resorts

A seasoned hotelier, Kaul began his hospitality career with The Oberoi Hotels and Resorts in 1978, before finally taking over as Vice-President of Oberoi Hotels Egypt.

Subsequent to this, he was Vice-President of Taj Mumbai Hotels, and General Manager of The Taj Mahal Palace & Tower. Kaul joined Leela as Senior Vice-President in March 2006, taking over operations at the Group across six properties as well as the planning for The Leela Palace, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi and the Leela Palace, Chennai. In 2010, The Leela Hotel Group announced the elevation of Rajiv Kaul as its President, making him responsible for new launches that the Group earmarked in its expansion plans.

Rohit Khosla | Senior Vice President Operations, Taj

Rohit Khosla, a postgraduate in hotel management from The Institute of Hotel Management Mumbai, joined the Taj Group in 1999 as Executive Assistant Manager, Taj Palace Hotel, New Delhi.

During his time with the Group, he has held several positions in India, Yemen, Maldives and Sri Lanka, and has shown unwavering support and dedication to the Taj brand. In this role, Rohit oversees all of the Group’s hotels in Northern and Eastern states of India (Rajasthan, Delhi, J&K, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Uttaranchal, Madhya Pradesh, West Bengal, Assam), as well as the Taj Dubai, Taj Tashi, Bhutan and the Operations of Taj Safaris. He is currently based in New Delhi.

Yateendra Sinh | Chief Executive Officer Laussanne Hospitality Consulting

The head of Lausanne Hospitality Consulting SA (LHC), Yateendra is at the forefront of LHC’s business strategies and client portfolio management.

He is an alumni of The Oberoi Center for Learning and Development (OCLD), India’s foremost institution of higher learning in the hospitality industry. He has held various senior executive roles in hotels, townships, and large IT infrastructure networks. Yateendra has trained and consulted clients on strategic and operational issues in over 36 countries, and supports the development of innovative solutions within the hospitality industry worldwide.
